title: Blisszi
author: Blisszi
content: The recent earthquakes in Turkey was pathetic and sorrowful, many loss their lives. The government of the country visited many victims area with the President; Tayyip Erdogan and others visitors who came to witness the tragedies and destruction of the earth properties. Life circumstances has no calendars, it happens everywhere and is really tempted sometimes to question the nature. Why is things the way they are? Why do people who are good to us perished like grasses? What's the hope not die young?But is understandable nature can not gives us answers, I sincerely sympathies with the country's losses.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Earthquake is a natural disaster we are left with no option than to face it consequences whenever it occurs, those affected never expected it coming, though it has been experienced on several occasions in the same region and people were still found living within this locations as well, it is unpredictable and people cannot overreacted to this because it's natural phenomenal, we all need to join others in praying for the affected families and quick restoration to all the victims all over the country.

comments.body: I'm curious. Since the damage was as widespread as it was, are the authorities having any problem stopping thieves who are stealing goods out of the rubble? Or are the authorities, themselves, moving in organized fashion to do the stealing?

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: I think that the figure you provided was based on outdated information, and as a result, it greatly underestimated the true scale of the situation, unfortunately. Based on the latest sources from the Turkish disaster management agency, it is reported that the official death toll in Turkey has exceeded 42,000. This is a tragic and concerning situation, and I hope that the necessary aid and support can be provided to those affected by the recent disasters.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Yes, it is not possible to face the wrath of nature. These are matters beyond the power of man, in the hands of God alone.The problem is that the aftershocks have not ended yet. We live near Turkey, we feel the big tremors, and we flee outside the homes. But in the earthquake centers, many disasters occurred and many homes were destroyed. There are thousands of victims and missing persons, and the rubble is still being removed until now.The humanitarian situation is already difficult and the governments of the world are providing humanitarian aid, but not all of it reaches the affected people in a timely manner.Worst of all, there are scientists who predict the occurrence of earthquakes with great destructive power during the coming period. This causes terror among people until now, and they flee from their homes when they feel the slightest tremor.

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: There were a lot of threads about this earthquake already.According to official figures, the death toll is currently 42310. However the actual number is unfortunately much higher. Those who haven't yet been recovered from the rubble, those who cannot be identified and the disappearances etc. reasons this figure doesn't reflect reality. I wish there were fewer deaths, but this number increased due to improper construction, insufficient control mechanisms, contractors stealing materials, ineffective post-disaster organization and bad weather conditions etc. There was a great earthquake 24 years ago too, unfortunately we saw that lessons still weren't learned from mistakes after all these years.

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: Quote from: Blisszi on February 21, 2023, 01:38:53 PMLife circumstances has no calendars, it happens everywhere and is really tempted sometimes to question the nature. Why is things the way they are? Why do people who are good to us perished like grasses? What's the hope not die young?But is understandable nature can not gives us answers, I sincerely sympathies with the country's losses.The problem with the Turkish-Syrian example is the nature of the environmental disaster itself. Unfortunately, the scientific community and the entire history of science cannot deal with earthquakes as required. All seismic stations cannot detect an earthquake (no matter how strong) until a very short time before it occurs, which does not allow adequate precautions to be taken in terms of warning and evacuation operations. In addition, it is almost impossible to monitor aftershocks, their location and degree of strength. Almost science can deal with various natural disasters except earthquakes, including volcanoes and hurricanes.In addition to all this, there is a more dangerous element, which is that construction and building operations are not subject to standards commensurate with the geographical nature of the region. Today, we can construct earthquake-resistant buildings, but it does not seem that this was happening in both Turkey and Syria, although all research indicates that they are an active earthquake zone.

comments.body: All we can do is pray for those who are injured or have lost people thar they love. It’s such a tragic event with so many lives lost, young & old. Nature doesn’t discriminate, natural disasters mostly can not be avoided, there is nothing that can be done to stop such devastating forces.I just hope the people who have had their homes & lives destroyed get all the food, water, shelter & support that they need.

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: Quote from: DeathAngel on February 22, 2023, 09:30:13 PMNature doesn’t discriminate, natural disasters mostly can not be avoided, there is nothing that can be done to stop such devastating forces.I disagree with that. First of all, you need to take your precautions. It's a known fact that Türkiye is an earthquake zone. When establishing cities it's necessary to plan according to that. Zoning permits shouldn't be given to agricultural lands and soft soils. Not everyone can be a contractor, they must have various certifications. The building inspection needs to be done properly. Central and local government units should make the necessary inspections, not just on paper, they really have to check buildings.There is so much to do. If there are deaths after doing these, no one will say anything about it. But it wouldn't be right to call it just a "natural disaster" without taking necessary precautions.

comments.author: Coin63$
comments.body: Earthquake is a natural disaster. Natural disasters are God-given and there is nothing anyone can do about it. The sudden release of the energy stored in the ground to crush the rocks causes the earth's surface to shake for a moment and some parts of the earth's crust to move. is created, it is manifested through earthquakes. Earthquakes usually last from a few seconds to a few minutes. The earthquake that occurred in Turkey was a 7.8 magnitude earthquake which was very strong. Many people have already died due to this earthquake and even the country has suffered a lot of damage. In order to help the people of that country, relief organizations from different countries of the world have moved to that country with reliefs.

Turkey and Syria would not be able to recover from this natural disaster. Many families have been thrown into mourning and life will never remain the same. Many children have become orphans while some are now childless, widows, and widowers. Natural disasters are unpredictable but we must ensure that certain preventive measure is put in place. Everyone knows that some parts of Turkey are prone to earthquakes but I read that most building developwrs failed to erect standard buildings based on required standards. They are mostly driven by profit and careless about the safety of the people. The lands in these disaster-prone areas are cheap, so they quickly buy these lands and erect high rising building In a place that needs low and strong building.Most people died because of poor responses from the disaster management agencies of Turkey. They don't have the right modern equipment to carry out such rescue missions. This led to the use of crude implements that are less effective. The town planning is also faulty. Considering the disaster-prone nature of the area, there should have been proper planning for these uncertainties.
